content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>NH Office of Energy and Planning</origin> <pubdate>200606</pubdate> <title catid="urn:contact.sr.unh.edu:9275eebb-30cf-34ac-a1d3-ddb0f8ff75ec">Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)</title> <edition>One</edition> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <onlink><URL:http://www.granit.unh.edu/data/search?dset=gnis/nh></onlink> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Complex Systems Research Center, University of New Hampshire</origin> <pubdate>1986</pubdate> <title>NH GRANIT Database</title> <geoform>map</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Durham, New Hampshire</pubplace> <publish>Complex Systems Research Center, University of New Hampshire</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink><URL:http://www.granit.unh.edu></onlink> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> GNIS contains point data derived from the federal Geographic Names Information System, depicting the locations of all named places in New Hampshire.  Place name locations from the federal GNIS have been corrected and updated, based upon a variety of sources, including current and historic US Geological Survey topographic maps, aerial photography, New Hampshire state agency records, and current web sites. </abstract> <purpose> This data set will provide a quick reference for anyone wishing to determine what features in New Hampshire have names.  It will also aid those wishing to name an unnamed feature in New Hampshire, by indicating whether duplicate or similar names exist elsewhere in the state. </purpose> <supplinf>Data distribution tile:  statewide.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>1901</begdate> <enddate>200808</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-72.575068</westbc> <eastbc>-70.559961</eastbc> <northbc>45.299808</northbc> <southbc>42.693324</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Geographic Names</themekey> <themekey>Place Names</themekey> <themekey>Named Places</themekey> <themekey>Nomenclature</themekey> <themekey>GNIS</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>United States</placekey> <placekey>Northeast</placekey> <placekey>New England</placekey> <placekey>New Hampshire</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None.</accconst> <useconst>None.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>NH Office of Energy and Planning</cntorg> <cntper>Ken Gallager</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Principal Planner</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>57 Regional Drive</address> <city>Concord</city> <state>NH</state> <postal>03301</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(603) 271-2155</cntvoice> <cntfax>(603) 271-2615</cntfax> <cntemail>ken.gallager@nh.gov</cntemail> <hours>8:00 - 4:00 EST</hours> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>NH Office of Energy and Planning / NH GRANIT</datacred> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr> Feature names are derived directly from federal Geographic Names Information System. Some editing has been performed by the NH Office of Energy and Planning (see individual attribute values). </attraccr> <qattracc> <attraccv>FEATURE</attraccv> <attracce> Occasional, obvious errors in feature names (e.g. Ammonoosucuc for Ammonoosuc) have been corrected, but otherwise all names are assumed to be correct as stored. </attracce> </qattracc> <qattracc> <attraccv>FEATYPE</attraccv> <attracce> Source values were found, upon editing, to be frequently (5%) inaccurate and have been corrected to the Office of Energy and Planning's best judgement. </attracce> </qattracc> <qattracc> <attraccv>COUNTY</attraccv> <attracce>100% accurate.</attracce> </qattracc> <qattracc> <attraccv>STCODE</attraccv> <attracce>100% accurate (all values are for New Hampshire).</attracce> </qattracc> <qattracc> <attraccv>COCODE</attraccv> <attracce>100% accurate.</attracce> </qattracc> <qattracc> <attraccv>QUAD</attraccv> <attracce> 99% accurate.  Some quadrangle names have not been updated to reflect corrected locations of some named features. </attracce> </qattracc> </attracc> <logic>Point data.  No topology necessary.</logic> <complete>Data is complete.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar> Original GNIS locations appeared to be derived from printed latitude/longitude pairs and contained numerous inaccuracies.  All locations whose names appear on USGS quadrangles have been correctly located.  Features such as churches, schools, and other structures are estimated to be 80% accurate. </horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr>N/A</vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin> <pubdate>1995 (DRGs); 1968-1995 (original paper quadrangles)</pubdate> <title>U.S.G.S. Digital Raster Graphics</title> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> </citeinfo> </srccite> <srcscale>24,000</srcscale> <typesrc>CD-ROM</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>1953</begdate> <enddate>1990</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <srccurr>publication date</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>USGS Digital Raster Graphics</srccitea> <srccontr>95% of feature locations were tied to the USGS DRGs.</srccontr> </srcinfo> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>U.S. Department of Agriculture, Farm Services Agency, Aerial Photography Field Office</origin> <pubdate>2005</pubdate> <title>2003 National Agricultural Imagery Program Imagery</title> <edition>One</edition> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> </citeinfo> </srccite> <srcscale>40000</srcscale> <typesrc>online</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>200302</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <srccurr>ground condition</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>NAIP Imagery</srccitea> <srccontr>5% of locations.</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc> Dataset copied from Geographic Names Information System web site.  Tabular data contained latitude and longitude pairs for each feature.  ArcInfo Generate command created an ArcInfo coverage, which was then converted, using ArcGIS 9.1, into geodatabase format.  Features were displayed using USGS Digital Raster Graphics backdrop, and feature locations were adjusted to match the DRGS.  Where the feature was not visible on the DRG, 2003 NAIP photography was used, along with information culled from historic USGS quadrangles dating back to 1900, and with current information from features' web sites.  Upon completion of editing, dataset was projected into NH State Plane coordinates and converted to shapefile format. </procdesc> <procdate>200512</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>NH Office of Energy and Planning</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>57 Regional Drive</address> <city>Concord</city> <state>NH</state> <postal>03301</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(603) 271-2155</cntvoice> <cntfax>(603) 271-2615</cntfax> <cntemail>ken.gallager@nh.gov</cntemail> <hours>8:00 - 4:30 EST</hours> </cntinfo> </proccont> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc> Complex Systems Research Center acquired shapefile from NH Office of Energy and Planning. In comparing tabular data to spatial data, nine hundred and twenty-four tabular records were found to have missing spatial locations.  These records were removed from the data, and the shapefile was provided back to NH Office of Energy and Planning. </procdesc> <procdate>200606</procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Complex Systems Research Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>GRANIT Database Manager</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>Morse Hall, University of New Hampshire</address> <city>Durham</city> <state>NH</state> <postal>03824</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>603-862-1792</cntvoice> <cntfax>603-862-0188</cntfax> <cntemail>granit@unh.edu</cntemail> <hours>8:30AM-5PM, EST</hours> </cntinfo> </proccont> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <direct>Vector</direct> <ptvctinf> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Entity point</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>12447</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Point</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>4</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> </ptvctinf> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <planar> <gridsys> <gridsysn>State Plane Coordinate System 1983</gridsysn> <spcs> <spcszone>2800</spcszone> <transmer> <sfctrmer>0.999967</sfctrmer> <longcm>-71.666667</longcm> <latprjo>42.500000</latprjo> <feast>984250.000000</feast> <fnorth>0.000000</fnorth> </transmer> </spcs> </gridsys> <planci> <plance>coordinate pair</plance> <coordrep> <absres>0.002048</absres> <ordres>0.002048</ordres> </coordrep> <plandu>survey feet</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>North American Datum of 1983</horizdn> <ellips>Geodetic Reference System 80</ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.000000</semiaxis> <denflat>298.257222</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>GNIS</enttypl> <enttypd>Geographic Names Information System</enttypd> <enttypds>USGS</enttypds> </enttyp> <attr> <attrlabl>FID</attrlabl> <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef> <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl> <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef> <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>FEATURE</attrlabl> <attrdef>Name of feature</attrdef> <attrdefs> Principles, Policies, and Procedures: Domestic Geographic Names, By Donald J. Orth, Executive Secretary, Domestic Geographic Names (emeritus) and Roger L. Payne, Executive Secretary, United States Board on Geographic Names and Domestic Geographic Names, Third printing (revised) and Preliminary Online Edition, 1997 </attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Text</udom> </attrdomv> <begdatea>1901</begdatea> <enddatea>200510</enddatea> <attrvai> <attrva>90</attrva> <attrvae> Some obvious typing errors have been found.  It is to be expected that other errors exist which have not been found. </attrvae> </attrvai> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>FEATYPE</attrlabl> <attrdef> Type of named feature:  Derived from GNIS "feature class".  A feature class is a designation for a group of features in a broadly defined descriptive category. All features are assigned to one and only one class. They do not individually classify all kinds of cultural and natural features. By design, there are no Federal or industry standards or guidelines for feature classification. These classifications originally were developed for mainframe file structure search purposes. Although the terms are generally consistent with dictionary definitions, they may not conform exactly and are not always intuitive. </attrdef> <attrdefs>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523 (gnis_manager@usgs.gov).</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <codesetd> <codesetn>Feature class values and definitions for the Geographic Names Information System</codesetn> <codesets>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523 (gnis_manager@usgs.gov).</codesets> </codesetd> </attrdomv> <begdatea>1901</begdatea> <enddatea>200510</enddatea> <attrvai> <attrva>90</attrva> <attrvae>Values in many cases are a judgement call.</attrvae> </attrvai> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>COUNTY</attrlabl> <attrdef>The county containing the geographic feature.</attrdef> <attrdefs>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523.</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <codesetd> <codesetn>Counties And Equivalent Entities Of The United States, Its Possessions, And Associated Areas.</codesetn> <codesets> Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 6-4, Counties And Equivalent Entities Of The United States, Its Possessions, And Associated Areas. </codesets> </codesetd> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>STCODE</attrlabl> <attrdef>State Code</attrdef> <attrdefs>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523.</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <codesetd> <codesetn> Codes For The Identification Of The States, The District Of Columbia And The Outlying Areas Of The United States, And Associated Areas. </codesetn> <codesets> Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 5-2, Codes For The Identification Of The States, The District Of Columbia And The Outlying Areas Of The United States, And Associated Areas. </codesets> </codesetd> </attrdomv> <attrvai> <attrva>100</attrva> <attrvae>Values are accurate.</attrvae> </attrvai> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>COCODE</attrlabl> <attrdef>Three-digit code for county.</attrdef> <attrdefs>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523.</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <codesetd> <codesetn>Counties And Equivalent Entities Of The United States, Its Possessions, And Associated Areas.</codesetn> <codesets> Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 6-4, Counties And Equivalent Entities Of The United States, Its Possessions, And Associated Areas. </codesets> </codesetd> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>QUAD</attrlabl> <attrdef>7-1/2 minute USGS quadrangle on which named feature is found.</attrdef> <attrdefs>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523.</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <codesetd> <codesetn>The Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)</codesetn> <codesets> The official database of names assigned to standard USGS products according to USGS policy and procedures, including standard 7.5x7.5 degree quadrangle maps and digital products. Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523 (gnis_manager@usgs.gov). </codesets> </codesetd> </attrdomv> <attrvai> <attrva>90</attrva> <attrvae> Some feature locations may have been moved to a new quadrangle without this field being updated. </attrvae> </attrvai> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>FeatID</attrlabl> <attrdef>Numeric feature identifier.</attrdef> <attrdefs>Geographic Names Office, USGS, 523 National Center, Reston, VA 20192-0523.</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> </detailed> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Complex Systems Research Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>GRANIT Database Manager</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>Morse Hall, University of New Hampshire</address> <city>Durham</city> <state>NH</state> <postal>03824</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>603-862-1792</cntvoice> <cntfax>603-862-0188</cntfax> <cntemail>granit@unh.edu</cntemail> <hours>8:30AM-5PM, EST</hours> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>GNIS - Geographic Names Information System for New Hampshire</resdesc> <distliab> Digital data in NH GRANIT represent the efforts of the contributing agencies to record information from the cited source materials. Complex Systems Research Center, under contract to the NH Office of Energy and Planning, and in consultation with cooperating agencies, maintains a continuing program to identify and correct errors in these data. OEP, CSRC, and the cooperating agencies make no claim as to the validity or reliability or to any implied uses of these data. </distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>ESRI shapefile</formname> <transize>3.55 MB</transize> </digtinfo> <digtopt> <onlinopt> <computer> <networka> <networkr>www.granit.unh.edu</networkr> </networka> </computer> </onlinopt> </digtopt> </digform> <fees>No charge when downloaded from the internet.
